body_html:
This happens because C:\msys64\usr\bin is not in your PATH environment variable. So all Bash commands (eg. rm, ls, cat ...) couldn't be found.

There are two workarounds for this:

  • set PATH=%PATH%;c:\msys64\usr\bin, then run bazel shutdown to make bazel pick up the new PATH value
  • Run Bazel in MSYS terminal so that necessary directories are already added into PATH.

Ideally, we should replace all usages of shell command to batch command(native on Windows). But due to the functionality of batch is very limited, we still have to rely on Bash for a while.

body:
This happens because `C:\msys64\usr\bin` is not in your PATH environment variable. So all Bash commands  (eg. rm, ls, cat ...) couldn't be found.

There are two workarounds for this:
- `set PATH=%PATH%;c:\msys64\usr\bin`, then run `bazel shutdown` to make bazel pick up the new PATH value
- Run Bazel in MSYS terminal so that necessary directories are already added into PATH.

Ideally, we should replace all usages of shell command to batch command(native on Windows). But due to the functionality of batch is very limited, we still have to rely on Bash for a while.
